text:
Hi. 

I've got a bit of a bug with the jakarta regexp package version 1.2. I'm 
using windows 98, with Java 1.4 installed. I use the RE class like so:



RE dPattern = new RE(dayPattern);



With dayPattern being declared over the whole class such: 



protected static String dayPattern = new String("([0123])??((((1st)|(2nd))|
(3rd))|(\\dth))");



(And this regular expression works with the java1.4 util.regex package.)



But then I get this error from your package:



Exception in thread "main" java.lang.ArrayIndexOutOfBoundsException

        at 
org.apache.regexp.RECompiler.setNextOfEnd(RECompiler.java:207)

        at org.apache.regexp.RECompiler.expr(RECompiler.java:1249)

        at org.apache.regexp.RECompiler.compile(RECompiler.java:1281)

        at org.apache.regexp.RE.<init>(RE.java:495)

        at org.apache.regexp.RE.<init>(RE.java:480)

        at 
opennlp.grok.preprocess.namefind.DateDetector.isDate(DateDetector.jav
a:71)

        at 
opennlp.grok.preprocess.namefind.DateDetector.main(DateDetector.java:
183)



For compatibility reasons I would like to use jakarta-regexp instead of 
Java1.4.  



Regards



Meghan Pike
creator: 0199782@sms.ed.ac.uk
vgritsenko@apache.org
text:
Works for me with 1.3-Dev. Test by adding:

#999
([0123])??((((1st)|(2nd))|(3rd))|(\\dth))
1st
YES
1st

1st
1st
1st
1st


into docs/RETest.txt
*** Bug 6567 has been marked as a duplicate of this bug. ***
creator: vgritsenko@apache.org
